items.preText:
9:25am Five minutes to go. An interesting fact has been fed to me: this is only the third time in history that Bangladesh has used same XI in all matches of a bilateral series

Akash: "Windis have not won a one day series in years and this is the best chance they will get. But I'm confident Bangladesh will comeback from last match's shocker and win it. Go Tigers"

Masum Billah: "Eagerly waiting from UK, want Bangladesh to nail the series, they have missed 21 series so far since 2015. Win theory is simple, make 280 runs on board and restrict them to do so. Good luck "

A milestone is in sight for Bangladesh's Mushfiqur Rahim who needs 20 runs to cross Alec Stewart as the sixth highest run-getter as a wicketkeeper in all formats of international cricket. Holder: "We would've bowled first too. There's a bit of wicket upfront. And we back ourselves to chase any total. Last opportunity to win the series. Need to focus on all three departments. Two changes. Mohammed and Joseph miss out." Mortaza: "Not nervous. We'll bat first because it's a good wicket. The straight boundary is short, and the wind is blowing, but hopefully we can cope well. No changes, same team." West Indies: 1 Chris Gayle, 2 Evin Lewis, 3 Shai Hope (wk), 4 Kieran Powell, 5 Shimron Hetmyer, 6 Jason Holder (capt), 7 Rovman Powell, 8 Devendra Bishoo, 9 Keemo Paul, 10 Ashley Nurse, 11 Sheldon Cottrell Bangladesh: 1 Tamim Iqbal, 2 Anamul Haque, 3 Sabbir Rahman, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Shakib Al Hasan 6 Mahmudullah, 7 Mosaddek Hossain, 8 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 10 Rubel Hossain, 11 Mustafizur Rahman Bangladesh's XI is unchanged. West Indies have made two changes. Kieran Powell and Sheldon Cottrell have come in for Jason Mohammed and Alzarri Joseph.

9:02am Bangladesh have won the toss and elected to bat.

Just about five minutes to the toss. Here is the preview for you in the mean time: Russell injury hits West Indies ahead of series decider 8:50am Good morning! Welcome to our coverage of the series decider, the third and final ODI, being played at Basseterre. It's the first day ODI in six years on this ground, and the first international one in two. Not a bad game for a return. West Indies were so close to a series loss in the last match but they've hauled it back in to ruffle Bangladesh once again on this tour. Can the visitors overcome that jolt, put aside yet another off-field problem, and go away with something happy tonight?
items.text: length ball starts down leg side and swings further towards the right, but not enough. He can't get bat on it
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, 1 wide

items.text: length outside off with a hint of swing away again. Tapped into the off side
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: length ball on the pads, tickled to the keeper off the thigh
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: length ball on the pads, tickled to fine leg's left from the crease
items.postText: Kumar Vasnani: "The commentary here says its the first ODI on this ground since 6 years. May i correct that there was an ODI between SA and WI in 2016 where Tahir took 7/45..." --- Oops. Meant to say it's the first day ODI. Thanks for pointing it out!
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, 1 leg bye

items.text: length ball outside off, slanting across the stumps. Left alone
items.shortText: Cottrell to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: ends up at second slip! Yikes. That has slipped from Cottrell's hand and it's some early catching practice to his right for the slip fielder
items.shortText: Cottrell to Anamul Haque, 1 no ball

items.text: top edge to fine leg and it's taken, but it won't stand of course. Nice bouncer steep at the chest and he couldn't swing cleanly with the hook from under this
items.shortText: Cottrell to Anamul Haque, 1 run

items.text: full outswinger on middle stump, leans in and closes the face late on this to get it through midwicket
items.postText: Readers in India can watch this match LIVE here.
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, 2 runs

items.text: short of a length outswinger outside off, some shape away. Enough time to get on the back foot and nudge this to backward point
items.shortText: Holder to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: floaty length ball wide outside off. Left alone
items.shortText: Holder to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: length ball outside off, dead-batted into the covers
items.shortText: Holder to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: length ball on middle stump, stabbed back down the pitch from the crease
items.shortText: Holder to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: gets the back leg as this straightens after angling in at off stump. Some outswing. Anamul was looking to flick and had closed the face too early. That was going over off
items.shortText: Holder to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: short and wide outside off, lots of time again to free the arms and this time he punches it through cover
items.shortText: Holder to Anamul Haque, FOUR runs

items.text: overpitched on the pads, stands tall and handsomely whips this through square leg. Fine leg has a lot of running to this right to get to this
items.shortText: Cottrell to Tamim Iqbal, 3 runs

items.text: full on leg stump, clips it off the front foot through the midwicket region
items.shortText: Cottrell to Anamul Haque, 2 runs

items.text: length ball outside off, left alone
items.postText: Shaun: "Hope Tamim wont go in Turtle speed today. 40 in 40 better than 100 in 145. If you can't go with the pace, get out. Lets someone else take the chance. Its a team game, not a place to gain personal marks."
items.shortText: Cottrell to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: short in the corridor, mistimed cut into the covers
items.shortText: Cottrell to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: length ball on middle stump, jabbed uppishly into the leg side from the crease. That stopped on him
items.shortText: Cottrell to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: length outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Cottrell to Anamul Haque, no run

items.text: length on middle stump, closes the face and clips to midwicket
items.shortText: Holder to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: length ball wide outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Holder to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: length at middle stump, tapped down the pitch at the bowler
items.shortText: Holder to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: overpitched ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
items.shortText: Holder to Tamim Iqbal, 1 wide

items.text: length ball wide outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Holder to Tamim Iqbal, no run
